marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Reports Current‑Account Deficit of US$1.15 Billion in Q4 2024
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Central Bank (Bank Indonesia) reported that the current‑account deficit reached US$1.15 billion in the fourth quarter of 2024, compared with a deficit of US$1.38 billion in Q4 2023 and US$2.01 billion in Q3 2024, marking the seventh consecutive quarterly deficit but the smallest in the series. The cumulative current‑account deficit for 2024 amounted to US$8.9 billion, equivalent to 0.6 % of GDP, widening from a deficit of US$2 billion (0.1 % of GDP) in 2023. Bank Indonesia projects the 2025 current‑account deficit to be in the range of 0.5‑1.3 % of GDP.

marketNews.title: President Donald Trump Announces Approx. 25% Tariff on Auto, Semiconductor and Pharma Imports
marketNews.content: U.S. President Donald Trump announced that a tariff of about 25 % will be imposed on imports of automobiles, semiconductors and pharmaceuticals, with the tariff on automobiles expected to take effect as early as 2 April 2025.

marketNews.title: Indonesia’s Coordinating Minister Says Global Minimum Tax Will Not Be Implemented for Now
marketNews.content: Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto signaled that the government will not implement the 15 % global minimum tax at this time, stating that the administration is reviewing the global situation before any adoption and may follow the U.S. decision to abandon the global minimum tax after the executive orders issued on 20 January 2025.

marketNews.title: Finance Minister Announces Potential Increase in FLPP Funding for 3‑Million‑House Programme
marketNews.content: Finance Minister Sri Mulyani said on 19 February that the Ministry of Finance, together with the State‑Owned Enterprises Ministry and Bank Indonesia, will seek additional financing instruments to support the government’s three‑million‑house‑per‑year programme. One option under study is a larger fiscal allocation for the liquidity‑support facility for housing (FLPP). For 2025 the state budget allocates IDR 18 trillion for FLPP liquidity assistance and injects working‑capital into PT Sarana Multigriya Finansial to channel 220,000 mortgage loans to low‑income households at a 5 % interest rate for a 20‑year term.

marketNews.title: Regulation No. 12/2025 Extends PPN DTP and PPnBM DTP Incentives for EVs and Hybrids
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Finance issued Regulation No. 12/2025, extending the government‑subsidised value‑added tax (PPN DTP) on electric vehicle sales and the government‑subsidised luxury‑goods sales tax (PPnBM DTP) on hybrid vehicles. The measures take effect on 4 February 2025 and run through the end of 2025. The PPN DTP rate remains 10 % of the selling price for EVs with at least 40 % local content and 5 % for certain electric buses with 20‑40 % local content. The PPnBM DTP rate is 3 % for full‑hybrid, mild‑hybrid and plug‑in‑hybrid vehicles that meet the low‑emission criteria in Government Regulation No. 74/2021.

marketNews.title: Indonesia to Ban Over‑Dimension and Over‑loading Trucks (ODOL) to Boost Road Safety
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Transportation and the Ministry of Public Works agreed to implement a policy that bans over‑dimension and overloaded trucks (ODOL) to improve traffic safety, although the Indonesia Toll Road Watch coordinator warned that the measure could raise industrial product prices and suggested subsidies for logistics operators.

marketNews.title: Pertamina Sets 2025 Production Targets for Crude, Gas and Refined Products
marketNews.content: Pertamina’s Vice President Wiko Migantoro said on 20 February that the company targets crude oil production of 416,000 barrels per day in 2025, a 4 % year‑on‑year increase over 2024. Gas production is targeted at 2,536 MMSCFD, also about 3 % higher than 2024. Down‑stream, the refinery is expected to produce 334 million barrels of products in 2025, a 3 % rise, with the yield of valuable products to stay at 83 %.

marketNews.title: Government Announces 10 % Toll‑Road and Airline‑Ticket Discounts for 2025 Lebaran
marketNews.content: The Directorate General of Public Works, represented by Roy Rizali Anwar, announced on 19 February that the toll‑road discount for the 2025 Lebaran period will be at least 10 % – the same level as the Christmas‑New‑Year period. In a separate statement, Coordinating Minister Airlangga Hartarto said the government will also provide a 10 % airline‑ticket discount for the week before and after the 2025 Lebaran holiday.

marketNews.title: East Ventures Plans IPO of Portfolio Start‑up Valued Over IDR 1 Trillion
marketNews.content: East Ventures co‑founder and Managing Partner Willson Cuaca said the firm will bring one of its portfolio start‑ups to an initial public offering on the Indonesia Stock Exchange with a valuation of more than IDR 1 trillion. The specific sector and company were not disclosed, although rumours have linked the move to firms such as Fore Coffee and Sociolla.

marketNews.title: Bloomberg Reports PT Gunbuster Nickel Nears Full Production Shutdown
marketNews.content: The Bloomberg report states that PT Gunbuster Nickel Industry, one of Indonesia’s largest nickel‑pig‑iron smelters, has cut production and is close to a total shutdown. The shutdown follows the bankruptcy of its Chinese parent, Jiangsu Delong Nickel Industry Co., which has left the plant unable to pay local power suppliers and to secure nickel ore. The plant’s nominal capacity is 1.8 million tonnes of nickel pig iron per year, but production has been almost completely halted since early 2025.

marketNews.title: OJK Says No Unusual Large‑Scale Withdrawals from State‑Owned Banks
marketNews.content: The OJK’s Head of Banking Supervision Dian Ediana Rae said on 19 February that, to date, there has been no unusual large‑scale withdrawal of funds following the recent social media call to pull money from state‑owned banks (Himbara). She noted the call was unfounded, while BNI’s Senior Vice President Trioksa Siahaan explained that the concern relates to the 1MDB‑type investment‑fund scandal and does not reflect a loss of confidence in Himbara banks, which continue to grow.

marketNews.title: Industry Ministry to Implement ODOL Policy to Improve Road Safety
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Industry, represented by Minister Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, said on 19 February that the ministry and the Ministry of Transportation have agreed to implement a policy banning over‑dimension and overloaded trucks (ODOL). The measure aims to improve traffic safety, although the Ministry of Transportation’s toll‑road watch coordinator warned that the policy could trigger higher industrial‑product prices and suggested subsidies for logistics operators.

marketNews.title: Government Announces 10 % Airline‑Ticket Discount for 2025 Lebaran
marketNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, reiterated that the government will provide a 10 % discount on airline tickets for the week before and after the 2025 Lebaran holiday, in addition to the 10 % toll‑road discount announced for the same period.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Confirms Toll‑Road and Airline‑Ticket Discounts for Ramadan and Lebaran 2025
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto confirmed earlier this week that the government will provide both toll‑road and airline‑ticket discounts during Ramadan and Lebaran to stimulate economic growth in the first quarter of 2025.

tickerNews.title: BNGA Reports 2024 Net Profit of IDR 6.8 trillion, 5.4 % YoY Growth
tickerNews.content: Bank CIMB Niaga reported net profit of IDR 1.7 trillion in 4Q 2024 (up 7.6 % YoY, down 1.9 % QoQ). The full‑year 2024 net profit rose 5.4 % YoY to IDR 6.8 trillion, equal to 101 % of consensus. The result was driven by credit‑cost (CoC), loan growth and a net‑interest‑margin (NIM) that matched guidance. NIM for 4Q 24 was 3.9 % (‑17 bps YoY, ‑19 bps QoQ); the 2024 average NIM was 4.1 % (‑31 bps YoY), within the 4.1‑4.2 % guidance range. Loan‑to‑deposit ratio fell to 86.3 % in 2024 (vs 89.3 % in 2023).

tickerNews.title: FTSE Russell Says Barito Renewables May Re‑Enter FTSE Index
tickerNews.content: FTSE Russell’s Policy Director Wanming Du said Barito Renewables Energy (ticker BREN) can still be admitted to the FTSE index provided it meets the transparency, investability and replicability criteria, and satisfies the minimum 5 % free‑float requirement. The firm was removed from the FTSE Global Equity Series – Large Cap in September 2024 because 97 % of its shares are held by four shareholders, breaching the free‑float threshold.

tickerNews.title: Toyota Astra Motor Says It Is Ready to Produce Battery‑Electric Vehicles in Indonesia
tickerNews.content: PT Toyota Astra Motor’s Head of Public Relations Philardi Sobari said the company is ready to produce battery‑electric vehicles (BEV) in Indonesia to make them more affordable, although no timeline was given. He added that, following Toyota’s global direction, all currently imported completely‑built‑up models could be produced locally, including BEV, hybrid, plug‑in‑hybrid and internal‑combustion‑engine models, with the transition strategy focused on moving from ICE to hybrid.

tickerNews.title: Agung Podomoro Land Posts 54 % YoY Rise in 2024 Marketing‑Sales
tickerNews.content: Agung Podomoro Land reported marketing‑sales of approximately IDR 1.9 trillion in 2024, a 54 % year‑on‑year increase. The 4Q 2024 marketing‑sales figure was about IDR 530 billion (‑8 % QoQ, +79 % YoY). CEO Bacelius Ruru said the company will focus on the low‑mid‑price housing segment (IDR 200‑500 million per unit) in 2025, without disclosing a specific sales target.

tickerNews.title: ACES Reports January 2025 Same‑Store‑Sales Growth of +3.4 % YoY
tickerNews.content: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia recorded a same‑store‑sales growth (SSSG) of +3.4 % YoY in January 2025, down from +7 % YoY in December 2024 and +5.6 % YoY in January 2024. The highest SSSG was in the non‑Javanese islands (+8.1 % YoY), followed by Java outside Jakarta (+1.3 % YoY) and Jakarta (‑0.5 % YoY). Total store count rose to 246 in January 2025, an increase of one store + 1.

tickerNews.title: BNBR Sells 500 Million VKTR Shares for IDR 100 Each
tickerNews.content: Bakrie & Brothers (BNBR) sold 500 million shares of VKTR at an average price of IDR 100 per share on 17 February 2025, amounting to roughly IDR 50 billion. The transaction reduced BNBR’s ownership in VKTR from 30.41 % to 29.26 %.

tickerNews.title: Sigma Mutiara Sells 60 Million PBSA Shares for IDR 334 Each
tickerNews.content: Parametr Bang Sarana (PT Sigma Mutiara) sold 60 million shares of PBSA at an average price of IDR 334 per share, totaling about IDR 20 billion. The sale reduced the ownership of PT Sigma Mutiara in PBSA from 31 % (actually 39.56 % per the filing, but the release says 39.56 % to 37.56 %) to 37.56 %.

tickerNews.title: Anderson Bay Pte Ltd. Plans Mandatory‑Tender‑Offer for 90 % of CNKO
tickerNews.content: The new shareholder‑owner of Exploitasi Energi Indonesia (CNKO) – Anderson Anderson Bay Pte. Ltd. plans a compulsory‑tender offer for 90 % of CNKO’s shares at IDR 8 per share, scheduled for 17 February–18 March 2025. The offer follows an earlier December 2024 purchase of 10 % of CNKO for about IDR 6.3 billion (7 % per share) by Anderson Bay Pte. Ltd.
